intro: Potamogeton besseri, commonly known as Bessera watermilfoil, is a submerged aquatic plant native to North America. It has slender, branching stems that are often found in shallow, freshwater habitats such as ponds and lakes. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically arranged in clusters along the stems. Its leaves are narrow and ribbon-like, often with a slight ridge along the upper surface. Potamogeton besseri plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
